page.title: 11New Forest-Felling Conifers2
page.content: {<Cont} 3.{Timber-}This has to be over 4 m in length and have a minimum of 18 cms diameter at the end of the tree after topping. Fresh felled timber is measured by the cubic metre. This goes to sawmills within a 100 km radius and is used for fencing, planking, and in house building. The{Douglas Fir}is the most valuable tree and fetches around Â£47/cubic metre. However, when replanting, these trees need to be fenced as they are liked by deer. This is not the case with the{Corsican Pine}which is becoming popular as it has a good growth rate that is almost 2 times that of{Scots Pine}and the wood is less knotted. This fetches around Â£37/cubic metre and{Scots Pine}around Â£30/cubic metre.
